learner¶

All the learners must implement:

  • fit

  • predict

  • predict_proba

  • accuracy

class learner.CalibratedLogisticLearner(privileged_groups, unprivileged_groups)¶

Fits a logistic regression and then calibrates for each of the two groups individually using platts scaling

accuracy(dataset)¶

Calculates accuracy of learner for some dataset.

Parameters

dataset – AIF360 dataset

Returns

Accuracy ([0,1])

fit(dataset)¶

Fits the classifier on the dataset.

Parameters

dataset – Some AIF360 dataset

predict(x)¶

Makes predictions for feature matrix x.

Parameters

X – feature matrix (dimension num_instances x num_features)

Returns

Vector containing the predicted labels

predict_proba(x)¶

Makes predictions for feature matrix x.

Parameters

X – feature matrix (dimension num_instances x num_features)

Returns

Probability vector

class learner.LogisticLearner(exclude_protected=False)¶

Unconstrained Logistic Regression learner.

Parameters

exclude_protected – if true, learner ignores protected attribute during training

accuracy(dataset)¶

Calculates accuracy of learner for some dataset.

Parameters

Returns

Makes predictions for feature matrix x.

Parameters

X – feature matrix (dimension num_instances x num_features)

Returns

Probability vector

class learner.RejectOptionsLogisticLearner(privileged_groups, unprivileged_groups, metric_name='Statistical parity difference', abs_bound=0.05, exclude_protected=False)¶

Reject Options post-processing technique is applied on a logistic regression model.

class learner.GaussianNBLearner(exclude_protected=False)¶

A unconstrained naive bayes model is used for this learner.

class learner.ReweighingLogisticLearner(privileged_group, unprivileged_group)¶

Instances are weighted s.t. statistical parity difference on training set is 0. Afterwards a logistic regression model is fitted on the weighted dataset.

accuracy(dataset)¶

Calculates accuracy of learner for some dataset.

class learner.FairLearnLearner(privileged_group, unprivileged_group)¶

FairLearn is an in-processing technique which jointly optimizes accuracy and fairness.

learner.utils._accuracy(h, dataset)¶

Utility function to calculate accuracy.

Parameters

  • h – Classification function

  • dataset – Dataset containing features and true labels

Returns

Accuracy

learner.utils._drop_protected(dataset, features)¶

Utility function to drop protected attributes from feature matrix features.

Parameters

  • dataset – AIF360 dataset containing information about protected features..

  • features – Feature matrix (dimension: n_instances x n_features)

Returns

Modified feature matrix (dimension: n_instances x (n_features - n_protected_features))
